title: Looking for a blocky rounded geometric sans
content: It is a very blocky, solid style, with hard edges and 90 degree angles. Very much like impact. The main difference is that the m doesn't have a hard straight line on the left side and instead it's two symmetric rainbows. And the W is more like an upside down M, it doesn't have hard corners, instead it's rounded. Overall is a very thick font with straight edges, symmetric, rounded edges. Any names come to mind? Thanks
author: ohal3000

comments.content: Hi Ryan, I'm afraid word descriptions are very hard to follow and visualize. Can you show us a sample, or make a sketch and post the image (as a .gif or .jpg)?

It's not condensed like Impact but, otherwise, Fountain's OGRA fits the bill. It's got the round/hard edges and the M/W you describe:   
   
 [http://www.fountain.nu/catalogue/ogra.asp](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516054534/http:/www.fountain.nu/catalogue/ogra.asp)   
   
(You know you're a freak when you: a) are using the Indie Fonts book as bedtime reading, and b) leafing through the Fountain samples in said book causes you to get out of bed and post a message on the Type ID board.)

I think Ryan might very well be thinking of [Pump](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516054534/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/letraset/pump/regular/testdrive.html?s=AaBbCcDdEeFfGgMmWw&p=48). It seems to match every description he's given: the blockiness, the sharp edges and very rounded and symmetric overall feel.
